newsitem.title: USA: Newmont receives Batu Hijau permit.
newsitem.headline: Newmont receives Batu Hijau permit.

text.p: Newmont Gold Co received the construction permit and approval of a partnership agreement with Sumitomo Corp for the Batu Hijau copper/gold project on the eastern Indonesian island of Sumbawa.

This will allow construction to begin immediately, with initial work on the port, electric generation facilities, roads, accommodation and telecommunication facilities, Newmont said, noting all other principal government approvals have been received.

Construction of the $1.9 billion project is expected to take three years. Batu Hijau contains reserves of 12.1 million ounces of gold and 10.6 billion pounds of copper, Newmont said. The company owns a 45 percent interest in the project, with 35 percent held by Sumitomo and the remaining 20 percent held by an Indonesian company, P.T. Pukuafu Indah.
The mine is expected to produce an average of 550,000 ounces of gold per year and 270,000 tons of copper over a 20-year mine life. Newmont Gold is 94 percent owned by Newmont Mining Corp.
